entry.title: Barycentric Lagrange Interpolation
entry.summary: In my studies of the Remez algorithm, I learned about the barycentric Lagrange interpolation formula. The context is finding a polynomial of degree at most $n$ that passes through $n+1$ points $(x_0, y_0), \dots, (x_n, y_n)$. The classical Lagrange interpolation formula is what you’d write down if you “just did it.” $$f(x) = \sum_{i=0}^n y_i \cdot \prod_{j \neq i}\frac{x - x_j}{x_i - x_j}$$ I wrote a 2014 article deriving this more gently, and implementing it in Haskell for secret sharing.
